content: - Big stuff going on over the border in Pakistan. quote: The Pakistani army has encircled the Taliban in a number of strongholds across the Swat valley, a senior army officer said yesterday as the UN launched a $543m appeal for 2 million people displaced by the conflict. "The noose is very tight around them. They are taking casualties every day," said Major General Sajjid Ghani, who leads the fight in the northern half of the valley. "We are closing in on them and we will eliminate them." To prove the point, the army flew reporters to a mountain peak with a commanding view over the valley it had captured two days earlier after a 12-hour battle. Ghani pointed out several recently captured villages including Matta, a former Taliban stronghold. But the general refused to estimate how long the operation would take, and the sound of explosions and machine gun fire in the near distance suggested more tough fighting lay ahead. #http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2009/may/22/pakistan-army-swat-valley-taliban -
quote: The Pakistani army has encircled the Taliban in a number of strongholds across the Swat valley, a senior army officer said yesterday as the UN launched a $543m appeal for 2 million people displaced by the conflict. "We are closing in on them and we will eliminate them." To prove the point, the army flew reporters to a mountain peak with a commanding view over the valley it had captured two days earlier after a 12-hour battle. Ghani pointed out several recently captured villages including Matta, a former Taliban stronghold. But the general refused to estimate how long the operation would take, and the sound of explosions and machine gun fire in the near distance suggested more tough fighting lay ahead.
reply: - Big stuff going on over the border in Pakistan.  #http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2009/may/22/pakistan-army-swat-valley-taliban -
title: Taliban defeat in Swat 'imminent'

content: More of the right direction. "http://www.dawn.com/wps/wcm/connect/dawn-content-library/dawn/news/pakistan/provinces/09-tribesmen-forming-militias-to-expel-taliban-army-szh--02 WAZAKHELA: Tribesmen near the Swat valley are raising militias to prevent the Taliban from expanding their influence in the region, a senior military commander said on Friday. Major-General Sajjad Ghani, who is leading the offensive in the upper part of Swat valley, said people in neighbouring Kalam valley and Lower Dir district were raising their own militias, commonly known as lashkars, to confront the militants, Reuters reports ‘They are resolutely defending against the advance of the Taliban. That’s the silver lining that I can see,’ he told reporters during a trip to Swat arranged by the military. In a sign of growing hostility, villagers in Kalam and Lower Dir have tried to expel the gunmen. Several people were killed or wounded in a clash between armed villagers and Taliban fighters in Kalam on Thursday, provincial assembly member Jafar Shah told Reuters. Villagers had made a similar stand in parts of Lower Dir, to the west of Swat, and the Taliban had pulled out of some areas, a provincial government official there said. ‘Today they stand isolated, not only in the valley but also at the national scene. I think this is a big achievement of the government as well as the military,’ military spokesman Major-General Athar Abbas said.
reply: More of the right direction. "http://www.dawn.com/wps/wcm/connect/dawn-content-library/dawn/news/pakistan/provinces/09-tribesmen-forming-militias-to-expel-taliban-army-szh--02 WAZAKHELA: Tribesmen near the Swat valley are raising militias to prevent the Taliban from expanding their influence in the region, a senior military commander said on Friday. Major-General Sajjad Ghani, who is leading the offensive in the upper part of Swat valley, said people in neighbouring Kalam valley and Lower Dir district were raising their own militias, commonly known as lashkars, to confront the militants, Reuters reports ‘They are resolutely defending against the advance of the Taliban. That’s the silver lining that I can see,’ he told reporters during a trip to Swat arranged by the military. In a sign of growing hostility, villagers in Kalam and Lower Dir have tried to expel the gunmen. Several people were killed or wounded in a clash between armed villagers and Taliban fighters in Kalam on Thursday, provincial assembly member Jafar Shah told Reuters. Villagers had made a similar stand in parts of Lower Dir, to the west of Swat, and the Taliban had pulled out of some areas, a provincial government official there said. ‘Today they stand isolated, not only in the valley but also at the national scene. I think this is a big achievement of the government as well as the military,’ military spokesman Major-General Athar Abbas said.
title: Taliban defeat in Swat 'imminent'

content: The Taliban wont be defeated there like the Viet Cong. They will hide with the people attack then hide and repeat.It's not a get in a major battle and win.They can head north and jump in with the tribes. Ether way there not going to be defeated so fast. they might stop like the pak's control and then let them move out before taking swat back.
reply: The Taliban wont be defeated there like the Viet Cong. They will hide with the people attack then hide and repeat.It's not a get in a major battle and win.They can head north and jump in with the tribes. Ether way there not going to be defeated so fast. they might stop like the pak's control and then let them move out before taking swat back.
title: Taliban defeat in Swat 'imminent'

content: What are the Taliban doing "advancing"? Either someone is making a major bollocks of the King's english, or reports of an 'imminent' defeat are normatively comparatively superlative. quote: Originally posted by rayevinsonsr: More of the right direction. "http://www.dawn.com/wps/wcm/connect/dawn-content-library/dawn/news/pakistan/provinces/09-tribesmen-forming-militias-to-expel-taliban-army-szh--02 WAZAKHELA: Tribesmen near the Swat valley are raising militias to prevent the Taliban from expanding their influence in the region, a senior military commander said on Friday. Major-General Sajjad Ghani, who is leading the offensive in the upper part of Swat valley, said people in neighbouring Kalam valley and Lower Dir district were raising their own militias, commonly known as lashkars, to confront the militants, Reuters reports ‘They are resolutely defending against the advance of the Taliban. That’s the silver lining that I can see,’ he told reporters during a trip to Swat arranged by the military. This message has been edited. Last edited by: AliBubba, Sat 23 May 2009 05:02 AM

That’s the silver lining that I can see,’ he told reporters during a trip to Swat arranged by the military.

content: http://www.military.com/news/a...ml?col=1186032310810 They're taking to the hills when they're driven out of town. They're also taking to the refugee camp, for as the General says, telling the Taliban, which is a state of mind, from all the other Pushtun, is impossible to do. Watch for more of yesterday's bombings and violence in the cities.
